quotes.quote: When injustice becomes law, resistance becomes duty.
Injustice never rules forever.
Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.
Gender injustice is a social impairment and therefore has to be corrected in social attitudes and behaviour.
Injustice in the end produces independence.
Those who commit injustice bear the greatest burden.
You can only watch injustice go on for so long until you're compelled to say something. To speak out against it.
Injustice is censured because the censures are afraid of suffering, and not from any fear which they have of doing injustice.
If thou suffer injustice, console thyself; the true unhappiness is in doing it.
Nothing can make injustice just but mercy.
Injustice is relatively easy to bear; what sting is justice.
Every social injustice is not only cruel, but it is economic waste.
Injustice boils in men's hearts as does steel in its cauldron, ready to pour forth, white hot, in the fullness of time.
It seems to me that an unjust law is no law at all.
Since when do we have to agree with people to defend them from injustice?
If you look at any other group of people suffering injustice, women are always in the worst situation within that group.
I think people should be angry at things that are worthy of anger. Injustice is outrageous and deserves outrage.
Injustice can never be stood for.
The moment that justice must be paid for by the victim of injustice it becomes itself injustice.
The greatest injustice in the world is to bring a child into the world, and not be able to offer it peace.
He who commits injustice is ever made more wretched than he who suffers it.
Fight injustice, that our children might be blessed.
The glaring injustice is there for all who are not blinded by prejudice to see.
Fighting injustice keeps you young.
There is not a single injustice in Northern Ireland that is worth the loss of a single British soldier or a single Irish citizen either.
The injustice done to an individual is sometimes of service to the public.
People don't always get what they deserve in this world.
I guess the only time most people think about injustice is when it happens to them
If the misery of the poor be caused not by the laws of nature, but by our institutions, great is our sin.
An unjust law is itself a species of violence. Arrest for its breach is more so.
Man's inhumanity to man makes countless thousands mourn!
There is no flag large enough to cover the shame of killing innocent people.
Washing one's hands of the conflict between the powerful and the powerless means to side with the powerful, not to be neutral.
Undeservedly you will atone for the sins of your fathers.
When one has been threatened with a great injustice, one accepts a smaller as a favor.
The highest reach of injustice is to be deemed just when you are not.
National injustice is a sure road to national downfall.
Delay in justice is injustice.
An unrectified case of injustice has a terrible way of lingering, restlessly, in the social atmosphere like an unfinished question.
A personal injustice is stronger motivation than any instinct for philanthropy.
The truth about injustice always sounds outrageous.
There is a naive belief that injustice only had to be pointed out in order to be cured.
No one will dare maintain that it is better to do injustice than to bear it.
To do injustice is more disgraceful than to suffer it.
Injustice is a rule of the service, as you know very well; and since you have to have a good deal of undeserved abuse, you might just as well have it from your friends.
The struggle against injustice is just another kind of injustice.
Injustice is a scar in the surface of the earth and death to the victim soul.
When you take a stand against injustice inflicted upon innocent people, there will be those who will hate you for it.
Injustice alone can shake down the pillars of the skies, and restore the reign of Chaos and Night.
Everyone suffers some injustice in life, and what better motivation than to help others not suffer in the same way.
